intro: Pilosella immigrata, commonly known as the European mouse-eared chickweed, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, featuring slender stems and hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. Pilosella immigrata is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in grassy areas, thriving in temperate climates. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
